p: High frequency variants were present in the stock of both viral strains, however many of the variants detected in the tissue samples were not present in the stock suggesting that these sites readily mutate during in vivo passage. Because the PRVABC59 GenBank sequence (accession # KU501215) used as a reference for variant detection was obtained from direct RT-PCR of the original human serum sample [ 41], variants detected in the stock used in this study may have arisen due to laboratory passage [ 42]. Alternatively, because the GenBank sequence data for KU501215 is limited to consensus data, these variants may have been in the original clinical sample as subconsensus variants but not included in the GenBank consensus data. Understanding the diversity of the mutant spectrum in clinical samples is important for understanding which mutations arise de novo during laboratory passage and which high frequency mutations are indeed circulating in nature.
